title: Condensed Sans Serif
content:
Hi.

Does anyone know this condensed sans serif?

Thanks.

-  
H

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724110408im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Font_5443.jpg)
author: henand

comments.content:
Could be [Abolition](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724110408/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hold-fast-foundry/abolition) using some stylistic alternates (/ [Q](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724110408/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hold-fast-foundry/abolition/regular/glyphs.html#glyphs/602836/78), / [A](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724110408/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hold-fast-foundry/abolition/regular/glyphs.html#glyphs/602836/60), / [I](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724110408/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hold-fast-foundry/abolition/regular/glyphs.html#glyphs/602836/69) and / [R](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724110408/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hold-fast-foundry/abolition/regular/glyphs.html#glyphs/602836/79)).  
Also pretty convinced I've already identified it on the same identity but can't find the previous discussion...

[Last time](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724110408/http:/typophile.com/node/115433), you identified it as [Prohibition](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724110408/http:/myfonts.us/td-41AsEu), of which Abolition is the condensed cut. To my eyes, Prohibition fits better than Abolition.

Ah yes, thanks a lot R.! My eyes were apparently better the first time :D  
Abolition? Prohibition? Choose your side!

Thanks.

Think Abolition will do the trick.

--  
H
